task.title: Rectangles
task.shortdesc: With ZWCAD, rectangles are closed polylines with four sides. You draw a rectangle by specifying its opposite corners. The rectangle is normally aligned parallel to the current snap and grid alignment, but you can use the Rotated option to align the rectangle to any angle.

step.cmd: Choose Draw > Rectangle from the main menu.
Specify one corner of the rectangle.

step.info: Specify the opposite corner of the rectangle.

result.p: Opposite corners (A and B) Resulting rectangle

You can edit each side of a rectangle individually using the Edit Polyline tool on the Modify II toolbar. You can convert the sides into individual line objects using the Explode tool on the Modify toolbar.

TIP To control the line width of the rectangle, type “w” in the command line, then type the desired value of line width. After you change the width of the line, the new width setting remains in effect for subsequent rectangles until you change it again.
